body:
Comment 2 by **kaushansky**: 
Comment on comment 1:: this is not a convincing argument. The same case can be made
against many library 
functions. E.g., in strings package, there's a one-liner HasPrefix, which could provide
equally exciting 
opportunities. How about Repeat function? It's trivial, too. So maybe we don't need
strings package at all? And 
why stop here? We can apply your argument to any library, and to the language itself:
for starters, let's eliminate 
'%" remainder operator, because designers "fulfilled their basic responsibility"
providing /,* and -
